title: Can I get a copy of my listening history on Spotify? - Quora

response.answer_text: As far as I tried no. Speaking as a French citizen, Spotify has to give me access to my personal information. It is also applicable to each EU countries thanks to General Data Protection Regulation - Wikipedia (even if for most, like fr, it was already true before). Still, in practice, I contacted Spotify in order to have it, which they declined. They told me that I could get an extract of last 90 days. I’m pretty sure that they keep a way longer history since they present yearly statistics in December. I find it really disappointing. I really love Spotify, and since I spent hours daily listening music I would really like to explore those data. Do not hesitate to keep me up to date if you find a way.

You can view song history of the songs played on your desktop app only, that too in a few countries only. You cannot view history of the songs played through iPhone/Android. But if you want, you can set it up for future. Spotify now comes with in-built support for last.fm. Make a Last.fm | Play music, find songs, and discover artists account and authenticate it via. spotify. Now, you can save all your song history across platforms indefinitely on Last.fm | Play music, find songs, and discover artists servers.

If you are using Spotify on the computer, you can find the History by clicking on the burger menu with the little play button in the bottom-right corner. You'll first be taken to your regular Play Queue, where you can add and remove (or change the order) of future tracks to be played.
